intro: Echidnopsis mijerteina, commonly known as the Spiny Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
